name: Canonical ESG Full Architecture
description: Structural definition of the Canonical ESG institutional data architecture comprising four canonical layers and cross-cutting design principles.

layers.name: Canonical Element Reference Model
layers.scope: Foundational data elements and structural relationships
layers.purpose: Defines the canonical element types and their permitted relationships that constitute the foundational data layer for sustainability disclosure.
responsibilities: Establish structural constraints and validation rules
Maintain element type versioning and stability
constraints: No external framework concepts may alter element definitions
All relationships must be explicitly directional
Element types must remain stable across minor versions
interactionContracts: CDI layer references CERM elements without modification
CMP layer does not create new CERM elements
SSS layer references CDI which references CERM

layers.name: Canonical Disclosure Intent
layers.scope: Disclosure intent semantics and structural constraints
layers.purpose: Defines the structural layer for disclosure intent, constraints, and architectural positioning without asserting authoritative mappings.
responsibilities: Document calculation roles and stability constraints
Reference CERM elements without creating new element types
constraints: All intents must reference existing CERM elements
interactionContracts: References CERM elements for structural grounding
CMP layer maps framework requirements to CDI intents
SSS layer references CDI intents for field mappings

layers.name: Canonical Mapping & Interpretation
layers.purpose: Defines the structural layer for framework interpretation, mapping rules, and non-authoritative positioning relative to external standards.
responsibilities: Map external framework requirements to CDI intents
Provide interpretive rationale and scope conditions
constraints: All mappings must be explicitly non-authoritative
No creation of new CDI intents within CMP
interactionContracts: Maps framework requirements to existing CDI intents
Does not modify CERM or CDI definitions
Provides interpretive layer for SSS consumption

layers.name: Structured Sustainability Statements
layers.scope: Structured presentation formats and field-level mappings
layers.purpose: Defines the presentation and disclosure layer for structured sustainability reports, annexes, and statement formats.
responsibilities: Document presentation roles and data types
Maintain format-only discipline without creating disclosure obligations
constraints: All fields must map to existing CDI intents
interactionContracts: References CDI intents for all field mappings
Does not create new metrics or disclosure requirements
Provides structured format for disclosure consumption

versioning_rules.major_version: Breaking structural changes to element definitions or relationships
versioning_rules.minor_version: Additive changes (new elements, new relationships) without breaking existing structures
versioning_rules.change_process: Proposed changes require architectural review against all nine design principles. No external framework alignment justifies structural compromise.

change_review_criteria: Preservation of backward compatibility or explicit major version increment
